heaviest_rainfall.status: The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 36.8mm.  The rain fell at 4.6mm per hour at times over the course of the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: Since records began on 11 April 2025, the highest lightning strike count in one day is 23 on 07 September 2025.

nearest_lightning.status: The record of the closest lightning strike stands at 4.97 miles on 13 May 2025.

storm.status: An active storm has been detected in the vicinity.  The last storm experienced was on 11 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 6 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (197°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1754 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description: The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.2 mm) and cloud levels (up 498 m) when compared to today.

Today’s average cloud levels is 91.2m higher than yesterday, 118.2m lower than the past week, 497.6m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 866m to 3020m and averaged 1808.4m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.
cloud levels.summary: The clouds will be high, plenty of sunshine is expected.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; mild and pleasant. Also, neither too dry nor too humid and very little to no wind will be present. A few light raindrops may fall, the clouds will be high, plenty of sunshine is expected, and a mix of sun and clouds. Low pressure may bring unsettled weather.
